transcript.speaker: Choose a format
transcript.dialogue: Regular Table Indented Condensed

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Greetings, welcome to the show.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Hey!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Tonight my guest is Corey Feldman.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Hey! (beat) What's with the shark?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: That's been there... for over a year.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Oh. Well, I don't remember it.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Well, it was one year ago today I brought it in and said, "Here is the shark, I'll place it right here."

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: (In the control room) What did I say?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: You said you were so excited about this merger that you couldn't speak.

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Uh, what merger?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: The merger between this talk show and that shark. I know I told you this.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: (Beat)

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: (Beat)

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Well, I don't remember.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Look, that is Ol' Kentucky Shark, and he has been there. Okay, Zorak and Moltar? Are we clear now?

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Tch, yeah.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: You don't want me to play you to your desk?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (Stops walking) When have we ever done that? We've never done it that way! (Continues walking) And if you think you're gonna get sympathy from the shark, well then you won't. (Reaches his desk & sits down, glances toward Zorak) Stupid. (Looks at the camera) Now, let's welcome Corey Feldman.

transcript.speaker: Willie Nelson
transcript.dialogue: Hello.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Or Willie Nelson, it, it really doesn't matter.

transcript.speaker: Willie Nelson
transcript.dialogue: Thank you. (smiles)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Maybe it does matter. Eh, hello, Willie, do you know Ol' Kentucky Shark?

transcript.speaker: Willie Nelson
transcript.dialogue: Gosh, I don't know.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (Holds Ol' Kentucky up to monitor, who starts growling) Well, allow me! Ol' Kentucky Shark, this is Willie Nelson. Willie Nelson, Ol' Kentucky Shark.

transcript.speaker: Willie Nelson
transcript.dialogue: My pleasure.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (Drops Ol' Kentucky) See, Ol' Kentucky Shark is the brand new mascot of the failing liquor chain that bought us.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Ohhhh, so now there's a liquor store involved...

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Look, in the heat of conversation, Zorak, I may have said certain things I don't believe to be true.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: So... you lied.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Are you slow? The alleged lie that you might have heard me saying, allegedly moments ago? That's a parasite that lives in my neck.

transcript.speaker: Willie Nelson
transcript.dialogue: (grimaces)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Mars will never put up with this.

transcript.speaker: Willie Nelson
transcript.dialogue: What planet are you from?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Planet of Hollywood. Boy, you can order a hamburger with predator braids. Ya ever been there?

transcript.speaker: Willie Nelson
transcript.dialogue: I don't, I probably have, but I don't, you know...

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: You'd know if you'd been there. Your guitar would explode in your hands.

transcript.speaker: Willie Nelson
transcript.dialogue: That's neat. Where do you get them clothes? (Sips coffee from his mug)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: I don't know if you'd know 'em...  Kurt Russell and Goldie Hawn.

transcript.speaker: Voice
transcript.dialogue: Up the chain!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: They made 'em for me.

transcript.speaker: Willie Nelson
transcript.dialogue: Now that's a helluva deal.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Oh yeah, the tag says "Made in Malaysia by Kurt Russell and Goldie Hawn".

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Don't ya think that's weird that the tag would say that?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: And yet it does. (Growling sound in background) See? (holds his sleeve up to Willie, so he can see the tag)

transcript.speaker: Willie Nelson
transcript.dialogue: You don't have cape houses in, uh, Spaceville?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (Looks at the bear) What's that bear doing?

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: He's walkin' around.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: He's probably going south, to mate with birds. (Turns to Willie) Bears are crazy, Willie. They'll bite your head if you're wearing steak on it.

transcript.speaker: Willie Nelson
transcript.dialogue: (Laughs) Yeah, oh yeah, that's, those are neat.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (Facing the windows, watching the bear) Yup.

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: How ya doin'?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: This next question is brought to you by Ol' Kentucky Shark, of Kentucky Nightmare Talkshow Liquor Corporation. You might remember him.

transcript.speaker: Willie Nelson
transcript.dialogue: Yeah.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: He's the fish you met earlier.

transcript.speaker: Willie Nelson
transcript.dialogue: He's my friend, too, I like him.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Really.

transcript.speaker: Willie Nelson
transcript.dialogue: Oh, yeah.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: All right. (Stands up, talks to Ol' Kentucky) Am I supposed to ask you this question, or you ask me? How's this work?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Okay, I'll just jump in here. Willie, who wrote the extremely famous phrase, "A shark on whiskey is mighty risky. A shark on beer is a beer engineer"?

transcript.speaker: Willie Nelson
transcript.dialogue: (Scratches his chin, then laughs, then thinks some more) Uh...

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Give up? (Aims his power bands at Willie)

transcript.speaker: Willie Nelson
transcript.dialogue: Yeah, yeah.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: The answer we're looking for, Willie, is Doctor Worm.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Who's Doctor Worm?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Nobody, so shut up.

transcript.speaker: Willie Nelson
transcript.dialogue: You're a good lookin' cowboy there, when you got on them...

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (Stands up) Yes I am.

transcript.speaker: Willie Nelson
transcript.dialogue: You're a space cowboy, is what you are.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (Walks over to Zorak's keyboard pod) Two, three, four.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: ("Singing") Some people call me the space cowboy...

transcript.speaker: Willie Nelson
transcript.dialogue: Do you have a second line in mind?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (Continues "singing") Dumb people haul trash around. (Stops singing) I'm still working on it.

transcript.speaker: Willie Nelson
transcript.dialogue: I think it's got some potential there, I'll...

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: That's good. (Starts walking back toward his desk) Because it's done.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Zorak.. (Trips over Ol' Kentucky and falls) Damn shark! (Stands up, face to face with the bear)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (Hiding behind Zorak's keyboard pod) Zorak, you must be secreting something that's attracting this bear!

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: I haven't done anything! (Looks at camera) Heh heh, except for this. (Secretes a yellow cloud) Merry Christmas!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Zorak, take your glands outside!

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Heh, okay. (Bounces away)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Phew! God, crack open a window!

transcript.speaker: Bobcat Goldthwait
transcript.dialogue: (In the thought bubble) Wow, Space Ghost, man, crack a window, will ya?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (Laughs) Crack a window, eh Willie? (Laughs)

transcript.speaker: Willie Nelson
transcript.dialogue: (Laughs)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Crack open all the... Gaaa! (The bear attacks Space Ghost, he invisos out)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Moltar, what's the bear doing here?

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: (Sighs in disgust) Here, let me show you. (Throws lever, a video plays on his monitor, showing the cartoon bear walking in the woods.)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Ah yes, my documentary.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Bears and sharks always travel together. (The bear stands by a stream and growls, baring his teeth, while a shark floats by on its back) Just look at them, walking through the wooded forest, paw in fin. (The bear and the shark walk by. The camera suddenly pans up to bare tree branches.) It's on account of their teeth (Bear and shark start to growl and fight) that makes them "Nature's Best Friends" (Title appears in center of screen, as growling and fighting continue in background)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (To camera) I made this for public television, but they told me it was stupid and grossly inaccurate.

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: (Throws lever, stopping the video)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (Raises his fist to Moltar) You been smoking?

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: No!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: I can smell it in your hair. Crack a window, will ya? (Laughs)

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Hey, look at this! (Secretes a yellow cloud again) That's gonna carry all the way to the village. (Evil laugh)

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: There ain't no village.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Choke on it, village!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Moltar, Zorak's secretion will certainly wipe out the village's sandwich shop.

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: There ain't no village.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: (Evil laugh, secretes another cloud)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: The village! (flies off)

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: There ain't no village!

transcript.speaker: Willie Nelson
transcript.dialogue: Hey, Molt.

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Hey, Willie, I'm going outside for a smoke. (Walks away from the console)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (Flies back to his desk, carrying a six foot sub sandwich) I was too late. This is all that was left. Their six foot party sub. Their king, Randy, made it for me, while I waited. (Takes several bites out of the end of the sandwich, and talks with his mouth full) No one will ever know their way of life.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: (From outside the studio, muffled by the glass) Hey, look over here.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (Turns to look at Zorak outside)

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Gimme that sandwich!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (Still talking with his mouth full) Zorak, get back in here. I didn't give you permission to go outside!

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Moltar's out here smokin'.

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: (Runs by, smoke trailing behind him) I am not!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Shut up!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Ow! (Space Ghost and the bear battle behind his desk, he pokes his head up) Shark, help... (The bear pulls him down again. The shark lies dormant on the studio floor. Space Ghost finally stands up). This is B.S., man. I'm gonna go see Doctor Worm and re-evaluate this merger. (The bear jumps him again)

transcript.speaker: Doctor Worm
transcript.dialogue: Be chicken malt lickin' daddy's head be tickin'.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Yes, I know.

transcript.speaker: Willie Nelson
transcript.dialogue: (To the bear) Hey, how ya doin', Tex?

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Eh, that bear's a Yankee.

transcript.speaker: Willie Nelson
transcript.dialogue: Well, (bleep) him.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: That's right, I just talked to Doctor Worm, and he had some interesting things to say.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (Scoots backward in his chair) YOu get away from me!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Okay then! (Walks to other side of set) Willie, I'm just going to do the show from over here.

transcript.speaker: Willie Nelson
transcript.dialogue: Good luck.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Oh no! (The bear grabs him and runs off stage)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Shark, help! (The bear finally drops Space Ghost near an open door) Ow!

transcript.speaker: Doctor Worm
transcript.dialogue: I'm so drunk I'm liable to do anything to you, boy!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Well...

transcript.speaker: Doctor Worm
transcript.dialogue: Now get outta here, before I put you in the worst headlock of your life!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Moltar, we need more shots of the shark. Shake the camera, make it look like he's swimming.

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Is that good?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Yeah, that's great. Where's the shark? Y'know?

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: I dunno.

transcript.speaker: Willie Nelson
transcript.dialogue: Is he around somewhere?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: God, I hope so, or that worm's gonna go crazy. Moltar... (Camera stops bobbing) Willie, will you entertain that bear for a few minutes while I go look for the shark?

transcript.speaker: Willie Nelson
transcript.dialogue: Oh, I think I probably overspoke. (Laughs)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Just wave some meat around. Zorak, where's the shark?

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: He's outside.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Ol' Kentucky, you shouldn't be outside there in that sun. You need to come inside and put on some sunblock and a wide brimmed... (Shark's head explodes) Oh no!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Moltar...

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: No, no, it was not us. (Laughs)

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: But it is funny. (Laughs)

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Yeah! (Laughs)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (Invisos to control room) Then how did it happen?

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Here, look at this (throws his lever, Space Ghost's documentary starts playing on his monitor again. The shark and bear are facing off to fight)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Ah yes, my documentary.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (Narrating) Why do sharks explode? (Camera pans up to shark in a tree; it explodes with a bang) (Illustration of shark with firecrackers in its head, accompanied by the text labels "Brains" and "Sex Organs" with arrows) This is because sometimes their brains and sexual organs are made out of M-80's. (Dissolve to wooded scene with another shark) Sometimes, to attract mates, a shark will explode. (Shark explodes) (Several other sharks lying on the ground explode in sequence as the narration continues) And sometimes they explode just to attract giant killer bees.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (In control room) Well, no bees are gonna get in here. Not in MY airtight fortress.

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Yeah, all the windows are cracked open.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Hey man, crack a window open! (Laughs)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Oh no!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: To the creek!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Let's talk about what went wrong with tonight's show.

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: (Grunts)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Okay, first off, who invited Willie?

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: You know, I, uh, I left my jacket back there.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Moltar, it's gone. Long gone.
